#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Murād Mīrzā
#Text=Murād Mīrzā ( Arabic : مراد ميرزا‎‎ ; 1509-1514?-1574 ) was the 36th Imam of the Nizari Ismaili Shia Islam community .
#Text=Life
#Text=He was a politically active Imam , possibly alongside the Nuqtavi Shia group , and had a large following . [ 1 ]
#Text=Murād Mīrzā did not always operate from the Nizari base of Anjudan .
#Text=As a result of his activeness , he acquired followers in Kashan and other central Persian areas .
#Text=Ali Shah , surnamed Shah Murad or Murad Mirza lived in Anjudan .
#Text=He had also retained his close relations with Shah Ismail cemented by his father .
#Text=His mode of living , his dress and food were characterised by a rare simplicity .
#Text=The Ottoman sultan Salim ( 1512-1520 ) began his long march to northern Azerbaijan after putting 40,000 Shias to death in his dominions .
#Text=He reached the plain of Chaldiran and the outbreak of war occurred in 920/1514 .
#Text=He inflicted a defeat to Shah Ismail .
#Text=The Ottoman firepower , consisting of 200 cannon and 100 mortars was brought into play with devastating effect .
#Text=After suffering heavy casualties , the Safavid artilleries were forced to break off the engagement .
#Text=When Shah Ismail left the battlefield , sultan Salim did not pursue him .
#Text=Later , he marched to Tabriz , the Safavid capital , which he occupied in 922/1517 .

#Text=Caterino Zeno , the Venetian ambassador writes in " Travels in Persia " ( p. 61 ) that , " If the Turk had been beaten in the battle of Chaldiran , the power of Ismail would have become greater than that of Tamerlane , as by the fame alone of such a victory he would have made himself absolute lord of the East . "
#Text=Later , the Mamluks of Syria and Egypt similarly remained wedded to their cavalry , and were also defeated by the Ottomans .
#Text=The effect of the Safavid defeat at Chaldiran was the loss of the province of Diyar Bakr , which was annexed to the Ottoman empire in 921/1516 .
#Text=Shah Ismail went into mourning after his defeat .
#Text=During the remaining ten years of his reign , he never once led his troops into action in person .
#Text=He did not devote his attention to the affairs of the state as in the past .
#Text=On the contrary , he seems to have tried to drown his sorrows by wine .
#Text=His abdication of his responsibilities in regard to the personal direction of the affairs of state gave certain officials the opportunity to increase their own power .
#Text=The clash between the Kizilbash and the Iranian soldiers began to be a threat to the Safavid kingdom .

#Text=Kizilbash were the Turkomans , who were distinguished for wearing red pointed caps , which they had begun to wear in the time of Shaikh Hyder ( 1456- 1488 ) , the father of Shah Ismail ; and thus they became known as Kizil-Bash ( red heads ) , and in its Iranian form , Qizilbash , or Red Heads .
#Text=They shaved their beards but let their moustaches grow .
#Text=The Kizilbash constituted the backbone of the Safavid army .
#Text=It seems probable on that juncture that Shah Ismail had generated a close tie with the Ismaili Imams in Anjudan , and granted them the title of Amir al-Umra .
#Text=There is its another reason that the Ismailis had joined the Safavid army in Khorasan , who had repulsed the aggressive advance of the Uzbeks in 916/1510 .
#Text=Shah Ismail had most possibly planned to seek the martial aids from the Khorasani Ismaili warriors to crush the uprising in his military if required .
#Text=He therefore , maintained cordial relation with the Imams of Anjudan .
#Text=Shah Ismail however died in 930/1524 .
#Text=It is said that the Muharram was an ideal month for the Ismaili pilgrims visiting Anjudan .

#Text=They carried usually a small taziyah ( replica of Imam Hussain 's tomb ) , and placed it in front of the caravan and passed through the teeth of the bitterest and aggressive places in the Shiite garbs .
#Text=They put the taziyah at the entrance of Anjudan , and took it again while leaving the town .
#Text=Imam Murad Mirza died in 920/1574 in Anjudan and was succeeded by his son Zulfikar Ali .
#Text=Capture and execution
#Text=In 1573 , due to the threat posed by the Imam , the 2nd Safavid monarch , Shah Tahmasp , ordered the governor of Hamadan , Amir Khan Musilu , to go to Anjudan to capture Murad Mirza .
#Text=Amir Khan proceeded to Anjudan , and while killing a large number of the Imam 's followers and taking much booty , was unable to capture him .
#Text=However , the Imam was soon captured and imprisoned , but again escaped , this time with the aid of a sympathetic high-ranking Safavid official named Muhammad Muqim .
#Text=With the help of his followers , the Imam was able to escape to Kandahar .
#Text=However , while in Afghanistan , he was once again captured by the Safavids .
#Text=This time there would be no escape , and after being brought before Shah Tahmasp he was executed alongside Muhammad Muqim in 1574 . [ 2 ] [ 3 ] [ 4 ]
